Activity: Check emails and respond to any urgent inquiries. Review feedback from @clinlead-1 and @rn-1 regarding the data quality metrics.
Incorporate feedback from @clinlead-1 and @rn-1 into the data quality metrics document. Ensure that the metrics are clinically relevant and meaningful.
Refine the weekly targets for improvement based on clinical feedback. Adjust targets as needed to ensure they are realistic and achievable.
Prepare a presentation summarizing the data quality metrics and weekly targets for improvement. Include visualizations to illustrate the impact of improved data quality on influenza trend analysis.
Schedule a meeting with @pchmp-1 and @his-1 to present the data quality metrics and weekly targets. Topic: Data Quality Metrics and Targets Presentation
Present the data quality metrics and weekly targets to @pchmp-1 and @his-1. Address any questions or concerns.
Revise the data quality metrics and weekly targets based on feedback from @pchmp-1 and @his-1. Document any changes made.

Share the final data quality metrics and weekly targets with all relevant stakeholders (@da-1, @da-2, @clinlead-1, @rn-1, @ehrdev-1, @ehrdev-2, @itpm-1, @pchmp-1, @his-1) via email. Topic: Final Data Quality Metrics and Weekly Targets
Begin developing a data quality monitoring dashboard to track progress against the weekly targets. Work with @da-1 and @da-2 to identify data sources and visualization tools.
Outline the key components of the data quality monitoring dashboard, including metrics to be tracked, visualizations to be used, and frequency of updates.
